question: Evaluate the method used in an example of an epidemiological study.

sample_answer.full_answer: A cohort study is a type of epidemiological study that follows a group of people over time to see who develops a particular disease (1 mark). The strengths of this type of study are that it can be used to establish a temporal relationship between exposure and outcome, and it can be used to calculate incidence (2 marks). However, cohort studies can be expensive and time-consuming to conduct, and they are not suitable for studying rare diseases (2 marks). For example, the Framingham Heart Study is a long-term cohort study that has provided valuable information about the risk factors for heart disease (2 marks).
